etymologies: mid 19th century; earliest use found in Edward Wakefield (1820–1879), promoter of colonization. From Maori poroporo

definitions: Either of two shrubs native to New Zealand and Australia, Solanum aviculare and S. laciniatum (family Solanaceae), bearing lavender or purple-blue flowers followed by edible orange berries. Compare "gunyang", "kangaroo-apple".
